questions.text: Paradoxical undressing is seen in death due to:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Hypothermia Paradoxical undressing is seen in moderate – severe hypothermia.

Highyeild:

Paradoxical undressing : Prolonged exposure to cold→ Paralysis of heat regulating mechanism of hypothalamus →Absence of cutaneous vasoconstriction of skin → Cutaneous vasodilation and flow of blood from core to surface→ Sudden warmth + Hallucinations → Person removes clothes completely / partially→ Dies of hypothermia Muscles contracting peripheral blood vessels become exhausted and relax, leading to sudden surge of blood (and heat) to the extremities, causing the person to feel overhead. Paradoxical undressing is a term for a phenomenon frequently seen in cases of lethal hypothermia. Shortly before death, the person will remove all their clothes, as if they were burning up, when in fact they are freezing. Such naked body, under circumstances – suspicion of sexual assault

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.Hydrocution / Immersion syndrome-Cardiac arrest due to reflex vagal inhibition while Diving into cold water . Option B.Dhatura poisoning- causes Delirium,Diplopia ,Dimness of vision,Dilatation of pupil,Dryness of mouth, Dysphagia ,Dysphonia,Dilatation of cutaneous vessels -Flushing of face,Drunken gait and Death due to failure. Option D. is an incorrect statement.

Table:

#MANTRA Injuries Due To Cold- Generalized effect – Hypothermia . Local – Trench foot / Immersion & Frostbite . Hypothermia : When oral or axillary temperature is less than 35°C. At < 30° c – Hypothalamus completely loses the capacity to regulate the Trench foot / Immersion foot : Seen on prolonged exposure to temp of 5 - 8 °C. Common in soldiers (winter warfare). Extremities are exposed – blisters rupture to form ulcer which finally results in dry gangrene. Frostbite : Seen when exposed to a temperature of -2.5°C or even less. In addition to fingers, toes, nose, ears, lips, face, skin becomes hard, dry, blackened –Dry gangrene. Paradoxical undressing : Prolonged exposure to cold→ Paralysis of heat regulating mechanism of hypothalamus →Absence of cutaneous vasoconstriction of skin → Cutaneous vasodilation and flow of blood from core to surface→ Sudden warmth + Hallucinations → Person removes clothes completely / partially→ Dies of hypothermia Such naked body, under circumstances – suspicion of sexual assault Hide and Die syndrome: The person finds shelter in unusual places like the closet, almirah to protect himself from cold, but unfortunately dies due to cold .

Marsh test- A chemical test for arsenic in which hydrochloric acid and zinc are added to the sample, arsine being produced by the nascent hydrogen Gas from the sample is led through a heated glass tube and, if arsine is present, it decomposes to give a brown deposit of arsenic metal. Silver nitrate paper test-5 mL of gastric aspirate and 15 mL of water are put in a flask and the mouth is covered with a filter paper impregnated with silver nitrate (0.1N) . questions.text: All of the following are toxins:- Atropine Colchicine Curare Arsenic Select the correct answer using the code below:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

If 1, 2, 3 are correct Toxin is a substance of plant or animal origin, produced to act as an antigen in the body. Atropine, colchicine and curare are the toxic substances obtained from plants. Arsenic is a metallic substance which is toxic but it is not a toxin. A toxin is a poisonous substance produced within living cells or organisms . Hence arsenic is not a toxin rest all are toxins.

questions.text: Sequentially arrange the following Clauses of 320 IPC: Destruction or permanent impairing of the powers of any member or joint. Permanent disfiguration of the head or face. Emasculation Fracture or dislocation of a bone or tooth. Select the correct answer using the code below:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

3 → 1 → 2 → 4 Arranges Clause 1 → 5 → 6 → 7 of sec. 320 IPC in correct order.

Highyeild:

Sec.320 IPC : - Deals with Grievous hurt 8 Clauses in it Emasculation – Making impossible to copulate / to perform sexual intercourse . Eg. cutting of penis Permanent Privation- Loss of sight of either eye Permanent privation of hearing of either ear (one or both). The loss of eyesight (or) hearing can be partial (or) complete, but should be permanent. Medical Intervention / Surgical does not decide whether injury is simple (or) Grievous. Eg: If there is fracture that is grievous injury (even if it is fixed) . Privation of Member (or) joint Member -any part of the body which can perform its own function (or) which does not regrow . Hair and nails are not considered as members as they can regrow. Destruction (or) permanent loss of powers of a member (or) joint. Eg: when fingers (or) hand got crushed (not detached) Permanent disfiguration of head / face . Fracture / dislocation of bone (or) tooth : Mere loosening of teeth is not considered or dislocation. It has 3 sub clauses 8.a. Any injury which endangers life (which is a threat to life) . These injuries, if not treated on time, cause death. 8.b. Any injury which causes a person to be in severe bodily pain for a period of 20 days- Tolerating capacity of pain is subjective. So, it is difficult to prove that a person is in pain . 8.c. Any injury which makes a person unable to carry out his ordinary pursuits for a period of 20 days. Ordinary person → simple tasks he performs through his daily life. Mere hospitalization will not prove anything.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A, B and D are incorrect.

Extraedge:

Distinction between culpable homicide and murder is very thin but appreciable. - An injury likely to cause death of a person – Culpable An injury certain to cause death of a person – Murder Eg: If A Digs a pit in the path of Z and unknowingly falls in the pit and dies -Culpable homicide. If A directly drags and pushes Z into the pit and Z dies , then it is Murder.

questions.text: Identify the postmortem finding in the image:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Suggillation Image shows blood set in the dependent part of the body, with blanching of the pressed areas. Suggesting not fixed Post mortem suggillation.

Highyeild:

Postmortem staining : Postmortem hypostasis Postmortem lividity Livor mortis Vibices Suggilations Darkening of death Definition: It is purplish blue or purplish red discoloration seen under the skin in the most superficial layers of dermis , on dependent parts of the body after death due to capillo-venous distension. The blood pools because the heart can no longer circulate the blood. Mechanism : Death → Stoppage of circulation – stagnation of blood→ Blood sinks by gravity. Time of Development : Begins / Starts - 30 mins – 2 hrs Well established - 4 – 6 hrs Fixation of lividity – 6 -12 hrs (8 – 12hrs) → Examined by blanching test. If compressed area is blanched – not fixed If the compressed area is not blanched – Fixed. Distribution : Supine position : back of body Not seen on those parts of body which are in direct contact with the surface / floor – pressure→Contact pallor ,Contact blanching Vibices - strips / bands of pale areas between the discolored areas due to local pressure. Prone position Face & front of body Side On the side on which body is placed Hanging Circumferentially over lower limbs and lower parts of upper limbs → GLOVE & STOCKING HYPOSTASIS Drowning : Face ,front of chest and abdomen,Lower parts of limbs. Postmortem staining does not develop in running water. Color of lividity and poison Color of lividity Poisoning Cherry red Carbon Monoxide Bright red Cyanide Dark brown Phosphorus Chocolate brown Chlorate, Aniline Nitrites ↳Reddish brown Black Opium Bluish green H₂S Greenish-Brown Septic Abortion Deep blue CO₂

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.Rigor mortis & Option C. Stiffening - - State of Stiffening of muscles with very little shortening of muscle fibers . Single most important reason is depletion of ATP . Option D. Algor mortis- Cooling of body after death . As metabolism of the body stops, no energy is produced, hence the body cools.
